Package com.hfych2.brickdestroy.model

Class Wall

java.lang.Object
com.hfych2.brickdestroy.model.Wall
public class Wall
extends java.lang.Object
Levels, Impacts is extracted from this class, whereas anything else unrelated to a wall of bricks is moved into GameBoard.
This class is the wall of bricks in all levels.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.awt.Rectangle area  
    private int brickCount  
    private Levels levels  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Wall​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio)
    Class constructor.
    Calls the Levels.setLevels(Brick[][]), Levels.makeLevels(Rectangle, int, int, double) and Levels.setLevel(int) to initialise level making.
    Assigns the first parameter to area

  • Method Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Wall

      public Wall​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio)
      Class constructor.
      Calls the Levels.setLevels(Brick[][]), Levels.makeLevels(Rectangle, int, int, double) and Levels.setLevel(int) to initialise level making.
      Assigns the first parameter to area
      Parameters:
      drawArea - the area of the gameBoard.
      brickCount - the total number of bricks.
      lineCount - the total number of lines of bricks.
      brickDimensionRatio - the ratio of the brick size.

  • Method Details

    • wallReset

      public void wallReset()
      Resets the wall by calling Brick.repair() for the length Levels.getBricks().
      Assigns the length of Levels.getBricks() to brickCount

    • isDone

      public boolean isDone()
      Checks if brickCount is equal to zero.
      Returns:
      true if brickCount is equal to zero and false otherwise

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel()
      Calls Levels.nextLevel() to proceed to the next level.

    • hasLevel

      public boolean hasLevel()
      Checks if there is another level by calling Levels.hasLevel()
      Returns:
      true if there is another level and false otherwise.

    • getLevels

      public Levels getLevels()
      Gets the levels.
      Returns:
      the levels.

    • setBrickCount

      public void setBrickCount​(int brickCount)
      Sets the brickCount.
      Parameters:
      brickCount - the brickCount to set to.

    • getBrickCount

      public int getBrickCount()
      Gets the brickCount.
      Returns:
      the brickCount.

    • getArea

      public java.awt.Rectangle getArea()
      Gets the area of the gameBoard.
      Returns:
      the area of the gameBoard.
